page.title: 14BIOGRAPHY-HENRI WINSTANELY
page.content: {Henri Winstanely}lived in{Littlebury his biography starts when he built the first Eddystone{Light-house}.He was a clerk at the works to Charles II at Audley End House.He built himself a house in thr meadow opposite the church.At the church,fantastic tricks were played on visitors.Among the curious things invented and made by this unusual man were,an armchair which imprisoned anyone who sat in it,a slipper lying on the floor which gave a shock to anyone who attempted to pick it up,and a trap door which precipitated the visitor into the next room!! By 1703 his great lighthouse was completed and had already been tested in minor storms.In November of that year,came a great storm in which the superstructure was totally destroyed. Winstanely and five friends perished.
